name: Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel & Conference Center

reviews.text: I stay in this hotel frequently because of its location and how simple it makes life while traveling through Frankfurt. The actual hotel is attached to the Frankfurt Int'l Hotel and the Rail/Subway Station. This simple feature makes it one of the best.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Business Trips In and Out of Frankfurt

reviews.text: Once you gather your baggage and walk over to the hotel (which is a little confusing if you've never done it before) you enter a very large lobby area that leads you to all areas of the hotel. There are multiple towers and I prefer the new towel only because the Member Lounge is in that tower.
reviews.title: Standard Airport hotel, only stay for business.
Great service, great hotel
reviews.text: Check in and Check out takes a little longer than usual even when the lobby isn't too busy, otherwise the reception desk staff is very helpful. The rooms are average size for europe but a little dated and worn. The staff is very helpful if there is even a minor issue with the room. Since I travel for business, the rooms are just fine.
They do charge for Internet but you can use free Wifi (limited) in the lobby area.
reviews.title: Rip off WIFI charge and indifferent Bar service

reviews.text: Its worth paying a little extra to get breakfast included in your rate. They offer a really nice buffet with great selections to satisfy your taste. There are 2 bars on the Lobby Level (Lemons and Limes) that offer 2 ambiances and there is an enjoyable restaurant on the lower conference level.
reviews.title: not my firts time here

reviews.text: Rude staff, dirty rooms, appalling sleep.
reviews.title: Terrible staff, terrible room, just terrible

reviews.text: The only good point, convenient to the airport.
reviews.title: A truly airport bussiness hotel

reviews.text: This is a large hotel adjacent to Frankfurt airport terminal 1. Lots of hotels use the term "Franfurt Airport" in their title but this is the only one that is truly an airport hotel. All the others are some distance away (the last one I stayed at was 8Km away).
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a pleasant stay and would certainly gladly stay here in the future.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel, especially if you are with your pets!

reviews.text: Good Business Hotel adjoining the Airport, not to difficult to access the city as plenty of Bus, Taxi and Rail links. Good alternative to a central Hotel when exhibitions etc drive the price up and limit availability. Reception staff very well trained and efficient everything else as you would expect from a 5 Star buisness Hotel
reviews.title: Very enjoyable.

reviews.text: This hotel is, conveniently, a few minutes walk from the airport. Would be an ideal overnight hotel if you are connecting through Frankfurt. I stayed 6 nights while working on a conference. The banqueting staff are all very experienced and helpful. The meeting space is very flexible, has great technical facilities and all areas are clean and functional.
reviews.title: Great to work in....

reviews.text: We stayed here right before an early morning flight to the US. We booked a triple and had a king bed and an additional single bed in the room. It was convenient to get off of the plane and walk to the hotel. Not a short walk by any means, because Frankfurt Airport is HUGE, but better than trying to arrange transportation. It was difficult to find the hotel from the terminal because we had a luggage cart. There were several options to go and the trick was finding the elevator in between the terminal and the hotel building. Once we figured it out, it was an easy pathway to the hotel. The room itself was comfortable and perfect for us. The next morning a porter helped guide us to the airport terminal, but put us in the wrong line for the airline (the first class line) even though we told him we weren't first class. He said because we had a stroller stand there. Of course the airline employee scolded us for being in the wrong line, but we still got through faster without having to get back into the regular coach line!
reviews.title: Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I booked in here as I was attending a congress in the hotel. This hotel is extremely efficient, seems well run, and is as convenient as you can get for the airport, being reached by a covered walkway. No real issues or complaints at all apart from the slightly over complicated arrangement for the bath and shower taps! Well worth going to if you need to be at the airport. Book online first to get the best rates.
reviews.title: Good all round airport hotel

reviews.text: The great advantage is proximity to the terminal and very good meeting rooms. The bedrooms are quiet but dull and dowdy, tired and jaded, North American in mediocrity.
reviews.title: still tired

reviews.text: Food in the restaurant was good with an extensive choice.
reviews.title: Particularly good service

reviews.text: Obviously this hotel survives on it's location. Staff during check-in were polite and courteous and promptly available when I arrived a 3pm
reviews.title: 1st and last stay at this joint!

reviews.text: After a good nights sleep I wanted to check out at about 11:30am in order to catch a flight to HK at 1:55pm across at terminal 2. After standing in the check out queue for 20 minutes I finally gave up and left my hotel keys on the desk and walked out. EUR 192 for a night in a hotel and you are expected to wait 20 minutes plus to check out!! Not this customer!
reviews.title: Excellent Posh Suites

reviews.text: I see Sascha Konter, Geschäftsführer for the Sheraton is regularly on-line defending the hotel's reputation. Perhaps Sascha should spend more time rostering enough staff at the hotel's front desk to avoid defending negative ratings such as this.
reviews.title: Great stay, but not without faults

reviews.text: I note with interest the Hilton will open in March 2012 in the same building as the Sheraton, much need competition.
reviews.title: Comfort and Convenience

reviews.text: After a week of cramped European hotel stays, this hotel was a dream stay! Very Americanized feel, spacious, great work space, variety in mini bar, luxurious bathroom, and great in room dining experience! Must admit that if I wasn't traveling on business I wouldn't have been able to afford the stay. Awesome room though. Liked the US electrical outlets in addition to the German ones.
reviews.title: A must for business stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel the night before our morning flight back to the USA. The best attribute of the hotel is its proximity to the Frankfurt Airport although it may be a long hike from the arrivals lounge to the hotel, depending on where you arrive at the airport.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: It is a huge hotel, over 1,000 rooms, so do not expect a "homey" environment. The rooms are comfortable and quiet, and the bed is quite comfortable. The Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel is what it is, a conveniently located huge business hotel. If that description meets your needs, then it is a good hotel for either business or leisure travelers who need quick access to the Frankfurt Airport for early morning flights.
reviews.title: Has good points and drawbacks

reviews.text: You can't beat the convenience to the airport.
reviews.title: Good choice for early morning flight

reviews.text: Tower rooms are fine, redone gym is very nice, Club lounge is excellent, service is generally good for a very large and busy airport hotel
reviews.title: Unexpected

reviews.text: The HVAC is very problematic -even the dead of winter, the rooms are very stuffy without proper air flow -in the summer, if you are expecting US style refrigeration aircon, you will be sadly disappointed. This is a problem with many European hotels in general but due to the fact that the windows are double sealed for the noise, it's really a problem here.
reviews.title: Hard to sleep in the day time

reviews.text: i stayed there for two nights due to a meeting that was taking place in this hotel.
reviews.title: a very good airport hotel

reviews.text: the hotel have direct access through a covered bridge to the airport.
reviews.title: Perfect for an early morning flight - worth paying for

reviews.text: it is huge.the lobby is very bright-everywhere there are windows even on the ceiling.
reviews.title: So convenient!

reviews.text: check-in was a bit slow-rather long lines.the front desk staff was o.k. quite welcoming and smiling.the room was a typical airport hotel room of good size.it had all the amenities you want for a good stay.lcd t.v. ,internet access, coffee and tea making facilities, mini bar well stocked, a large working desk, good matress , enough lightning.the decoration was a bit bland and generic but most airport hotels are like that.the bathroom though was completely updated.the tiles and everything was in very good condition but it had an '80's feeling.it was supplied by the usual sheraton cosmetics-quite good.there were ice machines on the floors which i found to be great.
reviews.title: Location = Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it was very good soundproofed.
reviews.title: Convenient Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is located directly next to the airport, Terminal 1, with convenient corridors so it is fast and safe to walk from hotel to the airport directly.
reviews.title: excellent location
Avoid it unless you have no other choice...
reviews.text: It is pretty quiet given the airplanes are landing and starting each 20 seconds ...and the highway is also very close.
Rooms are comfortable, check in relatively quick (in peak times more stands are advisable, since sometimes the queues are becoming long).
reviews.title: Still the best choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course along with excellent location there is a price to be paid by that, not very cheap.
reviews.title: Great overnight

reviews.text: Due to architectural set up and the size of hotel it is not easy to get to the room if you had a bad luck and got one at the very end of the corridor...
reviews.title: Cozy hotel with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying on the Club Level was well worth the money. The room was average and clean but the amenities included with the club level make it a fabulous stay. We paid around 190 euro for a king club level room on the 7th floor, club level lounge is on the 9th level.
reviews.title: Stay a Club Level room

reviews.text: A big beautiful breakfast was provided in the morning, including an espresso machine and an array of breads, croissants, meats, cheeses and fruit along with a made-to-order omelet station! In the evening until 10pm, we enjoyed complementary cocktails and snacks. Plus, free wi-fi in the Club Level Lounge.
reviews.title: Good location. Old rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at the hotel winstub restaurant was great. The sausages and kraut are the best!
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: Got here after taking short inter terminal train. Lovely receptionist at front desk, very friendly and efficient check in. Rooms esp. bathroom show age of hotel, would have been nice to have kettle to boil water as coffee making machine was not too clean. still can't drink out of tabs. I had a longer transit and in terms of location this was great to sleep for a few hours. Heard there is a new airport hotel so if stuck here next time may try that out
reviews.title: Very convenient place - best breakfast I know

reviews.text: International business class hotel with all the normal amenities. Located mid-way on the pedestrian bridge between the airport and the railway station, so it is a short walk to either. A bit pricey, but very comfortable, functional, and convenient.
reviews.title: Almost worth a flight cancellation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is literally across the street from the airport terminal; But you have to go upstairs and take one of the walkways over to the hotel. The airport signs from baggage claim are not very helpful and do not list the Sheraton until you go upstairs to the ticketing area. I used Sheraton points to upgrade to a tower room with club access, even though we were leaving the next morning before it opened for breakfast. The staff of the Club is very accommodating and the selection of snacks and beverages was adequate for what we were looking for. The room was quiet, clean and well maintained. I would not stay there if I were spending any time in Frankfurt, but it is very, very convenient for a lay over or to catch an early morning flight.
reviews.title: It is an airport hotel, but very convenient

reviews.text: One problem! If you request a wake up call at check in, double check it from the room! Last time, I did not get a wake up call; and this time I requested a wake up call at check in and later double checked it from the room. I was told that they could not find any request for a wake up call and noted the requested 5am wake up call. We did get this wake up call and had no problem making our flight.
reviews.title: Good one night stay hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here twice, one night each. Nothing fancy, basic hotel located right at the airport. if you are looking for a nap, then the hotel has a day rate where yon can sleep for a few hours. Don't expect anything special from this hotel, just basic clean, basic, solid hotel with good service. Very friendly staff. All spoke good English
reviews.title: Staying close to the gate

reviews.text: We often stay in this hotel while travelling to/from Canada to Europe and enjoy its proximity to the gates, merely several hundred meters. The club/towers floor is particularly nice, with its access to the lounge and free internet. While the price is high, we often used Starwood points.
reviews.title: "Pay so much for so little"

reviews.text: My husband and I have been staying here for nearly 30 years. I used to think it was the place to stay. Now I am not so sure. The location is perfect if you want to walk to the Frankfurt Airport. But for such a price, you would think that something would be first class. The bar was nice, but overpriced. There was a great restaurant in the basement. We were looking forward to a great German meal there. It has been taken over by the hotel and it is not the same. The food was average, and overpriced. The internet was free, for 30 minutes, but only worked from the lobby. In this day and age, most hotels offer free internet access. Here it is 19 euro for 24 hours. I think I will try the new Hilton Frankfurt Airport Hotel next time I stay at the airport.
reviews.title: Rest at the Airport

reviews.text: Our airline put us up at the Sheraton Frankfurt Airport for several days when our flight was cancelled due to Hurricane Sandy. The hotel is in an excellent location within the airport itself, making it very convenient for travelers such as ourselves to stay there. The staff were generally kind, and were quick to help us find our way around, not only within the hotel but around the airport. Our room was immaculately clean. We ate mostly at the "International" restaurant, and found it quite good. My husband still speaks fondly of the Wienerschnitzel.
reviews.title: Dated rooms, good staff

reviews.text: However, the room itself was tired and dated. It was not only the decor, although that left quite a lot to be desired. The heat in the room never worked. Although we were promised a space heater, it never arrived. There were no slippers and no bathrobes in the room, and this made using the incredibly cold bathroom particularly unpleasant. There were no extra blankets. I finally settled on sleeping in several layers of clothing.
reviews.title: Conference Venue and the food was good

reviews.text: The blackout curtain over the window was torn. My husband reported it, as did the gentleman from housekeeping. It was never fixed, and we were simply awakened to the early morning sunshine each morning.
reviews.title: Convenient but small changes would improve

reviews.text: The water that flowed from the bathroom faucet was oddly discolored; we had to let it run for several minutes before brushing our teeth or washing our faces with it.
reviews.title: So Convenient & Efficient

reviews.text: We were told that other wings of the hotel had been renovated. It looked like our room was a long-forgotten closet in the wrong wing of the place, where nothing worked, and no guest was expected to stay again.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel, great restaurant

reviews.text: OK, a bit pricey, but if you're in the military, ask about the military discount. 2 minutes walk from the airport, very worth it if you're dropping someone off in the early hours. You pay for the convenience. Staff is friendly at all hours. They care very much for your local entertainment.
reviews.title: Worth it for the distance

reviews.text: We were arriving on a transatlantic flight and had arranged to catch a train from Frankfurt Airport station to Dresden the next day, so we wanted a "no-effort" place to stay for the night. The Sheraton is easy to reach from the airport and airport rail station, and fit the bill. It's an enormous hotel, but surprisingly calm and quiet inside.
reviews.title: Short but comfortable overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After landing and collecting our luggage we arrived at the hotel reception just after 1pm. Check-in took a little while -- lots of people in the queue ahead of us -- but was in the end straightforward. Our room was reasonably large and comfortable, well-appointed like most Sheratons. It was also quiet; we heard no traffic (cars, people or planes) all night.
reviews.title: Not so good for the price

reviews.text: Our internal clocks were disrupted by the flights, and we didn't really want any proper food, so we went to the supermarket in the basement of the airport to pick up a few supplies (including for breakfast). Apart from that and wanting to sleep, we didn't really feel like doing much!
reviews.title: Good quality business hotel but slow check in

reviews.text: We had a comfortable night's sleep and checked out the next morning around noon. Check-out was straightforward. All the staff were very pleasant, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Extremely convenient

reviews.text: Was transiting through FRA, and this is the only on-site hotel. There are a bunch of 'airport' hotels but most of them are miles away and you need to take a cab or wait for the shuttle to and fro - not very convenient.
reviews.title: Very Convenient for Frankfurt Airport transit, though overpriced

reviews.text: This is a short stroll from the airport, very easy to access. Rooms are pretty big by European standards, very quiet, and the sweet sleeper bed ensures a great sleep.
reviews.title: Location is everything

reviews.text: The only issue is that this hotel is overpriced for what you get, but I guess that's because of the monopoly positioning and the business crowd target. I had booked using SPG points, but it was otherwise priced at close to 300 Euros, much more than better hotels in the city! I hear a Hilton's opening next year, which should bring some much needed-competition.
reviews.title: Perfect location for business in Frankfurt

reviews.text: While very pricey, the location could not be beat (until the Hilton opens anyway). It is very short walk to departures. I set alarm for 2 hrs before departure having checked in the night before. Easily done. I agree with others that check out staffing should be improved or maybe be made more efficient. Lots of keystrokes and timespent just to check out. Odd. One of the longest in the industry.
reviews.title: Hot in the Wrong Way

reviews.text: Most airport hotels are around the airport, and one depends on shuttle buses or taxis. The Sheraton Airport Hotel one can reach with the luggage trolley. The City is reached by train, which has high frequency, from the underground station, and any other German city can be reached from the near-by Inter-City train station. The rooms have all the necessary facilities for a businessman, and are decorated in contemporary style. On the 9th floor, on the club level, is situated a lounge. Full breakfast is served there in the morning, and snacks are served all the day long, with a nice variety especially in the evening, along with an ample selection of drinks. The large top-roof balcony, adjacent to the club lounge, is a pleasant spot to enjoy a cigar in this fully non-smoking hotel. The service is personal, and the staff do their very best to welcome the guests.
reviews.title: OUR MOST FAVORITE EUROPEAN HOTEL

reviews.text: Our plane was delay and we lost connection flight so we stay one night. Hotel was easy to reach, just 50m from terminal building, so no taxi needed. Room was large and quiet, dinner in restaurant was tasty. Staff was really nice and helpful. It is far away from down town but in our use it work 100%
reviews.title: travel plan chance

reviews.text: We used this hotel twice during our six week holiday to Europe.It doesn't hurt to belong to the SPG program but I saw the same treatment given to other people checking in at the same time.I was greeted with a smile and check in was quick,then shown to my room and advised of all the hotels features.My wife was tired but we were off to the ninth floor for to see what the club floor had to offer.The evening appy's we out as well as drinks.We were greeted by a young lady and advised to sit where ever we were comfortable and if we needed anything to ask.The food and drinks were excellent ,the seating comfortable .We had a light breakfast ,omlet,bacon,sausages,juices,bakery goods and fruit with a cup of what ever coffee you could want.
reviews.title: Great value and excellent staff
Location for Transit is Ideal
reviews.text: On our last day we had to flip a coin as to decide to stay in the hotel or go to the first class lounge at the airport..........The room was clean and I slept like a baby on the sweet sleeper bed
I would also say that all the staff was helpful with our stay and we wouldn't think twice about staying here again....Thank you to the management and staff...
reviews.title: Excellent stay, excellent meeting accommodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfect when transiting thru Frankfurt Airport. It's right in the airport. Rooms are newly renovated. Make sure to choose the towers section rather than the older part.
reviews.title: A reliable place to start and end a trip
I won't be back if I can help it
reviews.text: Sheraton Frankfurt

My stay at this Sheraton managed to do everything to really annoy me. I chose the hotel because I was attending a conference there and it seemed like a handy option. But it really is very poorly provisioned for a 21st century business traveller.
reviews.title: Convenient and Fantastic!!!

reviews.text: 1. Directions The hotel, at T1, is very poorly signposted when coming from T2 on the Sky Train. The hotel website recommends using the Sky Train as it only takes 2 minutes. But it takes a good 5/10 minutes walk from the Sky Train to the hotel and only because I have a very good sense of direction and spotted the hotel (ugly grey brown building) from the sky train, was I able to head in the correct general direction. It was only when I went outside T1 into the fresh air that I was able to spot the covered walkway to the hotel.
reviews.title: convenience

reviews.text: Even when I entered the hotel, signage was not good. There are 3 'desks' and it's not obvious what function each serves. The one closest to the airport seems to be for air crew, but were not interested in checking me in even though there was no one else at the desk.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Surely the hotel could provide useful walking directions direct to the reception desk, on its website?
reviews.title: Convenient bedfactory

reviews.text: Very practical location with Airport, great experience in food, services and very nice facility, well mantained. Also great solution for early flight passangers. Very complete gym with 24 hour service.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.text: Long journeys east and west may land you in the Frankfurt hub. The Sheraton is a quiet break on a long trip. It is very quiet, extremely clean, accommodating, and affordable. There are plenty of places nearby to eat and shop and to otherwise spend down time. Tired and ready for a hot shower, I just walk across the pedestrian bridge and moments later I am relaxed.
reviews.title: Wonderful respite while on a layover

reviews.text: If you have to stay overnight or near the airport this is the place to be. The hotel is connected to the airport by an enclosed overpass. The lobby was bright and super contemporary and the front desk staff were warm and accommodating. The room was large compared to most European hotels and very clean. The brightest star of the hotel is a Turkish bellman whose last name begins with a Y. I was running late for a flight and had a very heavy bag. Going from Terminal B to D is not easy and stressful. He carried my bags between terminals and could have just escorted me to Terminal B, but elected to go the distance. I will be eternally grateful otherwise I have missed my flight.
reviews.title: Best Location For Transient Travelers

reviews.text: The hotel is very efficient if you have a business in Frankfurt or in the area. Just a few steps from the terminal and you’ll get in the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Efficient business hotel with small drawbacks

reviews.text: There are some negative points though I would like to draw management’s attention to:
reviews.title: I hope I dont have to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to spend one night in Frankfurt as our flight back to the US was early in the morning. We chose this airport Sheraton because is it literally across the sky bridge from the airport and we were arriving around 8pm so did not feel like getting a hotel all the way out in the actual city.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay the night before long flight

reviews.text: The room was large (the bathroom also), clean and very comfy. We ate at their restaurant (Taverna?) late that night after watching a Euro 2012 game and were pleasantly surprised by the service and the food. Despite the kitchen being minutes from closing our meals were carefully prepared and tasted good.
reviews.title: Practical, functional and convenient for the airport

reviews.text: It is a popular place to stay so often there is a really long line at the check-in desk. We happened on a very nice lobby attendant who sent us to the executive floor to check-in there instead of waiting for a really long time.
reviews.title: Not a typical airport hotel

reviews.text: This does exactly what you'd expect of an airport hotel. Convenient - 2 mins walk from T1, 5 mins walk to the train station. Bar and restaurant cater for business types either for conferences or one-night stop-overs. Breakfast was a big disappointment - selection was large but quality poor.
reviews.title: Best place to stay if you are transiting

reviews.text: Rooms were large, quiet and functional.
reviews.title: Perfect location for conference

description: Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel is your airport hotel in Frankfurt. Directly connected with Terminal 1 of Frankfurt Int. Airport and only a few steps away from both regional and ICE (high-speed) train station it offers a perfect location. Free Wifi in our lobby and access to Link(at)Sheraton as well as Sheraton Club and Towers rooms with the exclusiv Sheraton Club lounge meet the needs of both business and leisure guest. Whether you want to relax and freshen up or get straight back to business before or after your flight, it's easy to do so when you are staying at the Sheraton Frankfurt Airport Hotel.
